taxi.service

Class EditAccountService

  • java.lang.Object
    • taxi.service.EditAccountService

  • public class EditAccountService
extends java.lang.Object
    The EditAccountService class implements the functions regarding customer and taxi driver account editing.
    Since:
    Academic Year 2016-2017
    Author:
    Team 4

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EditAccountService() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Object changeAddress(java.lang.String userType, long userId, java.lang.String address, java.lang.String city, int zipCode)
      changeAddress method, applicable for both Taxi Driver and Customer This method gets as parameters: the usertype (Customer or Taxi Driver) the userid the new address the new city and the new zip code The appropriate record is fetched from the DB.
      java.lang.Object changeCreditCard(java.lang.String userType, long userId, java.lang.String creditCardType, java.lang.String creditCardNumber, java.lang.String expiryDate, java.lang.String ccv)
      changeCreditCard method, applicable for both Taxi Driver and Customer This method gets as parameters: the usertype (Customer or Taxi Driver) the userid the new creditCardType the new creditCardNumber the new expiryDate and the new ccv The appropriate record is fetched from the DB.
      java.lang.Object changeEmail(java.lang.String userType, long userId, java.lang.String email)
      changeEmail method, applicable for both Taxi Driver and Customer This method gets as parameters: the usertype (Customer or Taxi Driver) the userid the new email The appropriate record is fetched from the DB.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • changeAddress

        public java.lang.Object changeAddress(java.lang.String userType,
                                      long userId,
                                      java.lang.String address,
                                      java.lang.String city,
                                      int zipCode)
        changeAddress method, applicable for both Taxi Driver and Customer This method gets as parameters:
        • the usertype (Customer or Taxi Driver)
        • the userid
        • the new address
        • the new city and
        • the new zip code
        The appropriate record is fetched from the DB. The object which was changed, is returned as result. Note: The method returns object in order to avoid several similar methods for TaxiDriver and Customer objects
        Parameters:
        userType - type String
        userId - type long
        address - type String
        city - type String
        zipCode - type int
        Returns:
        Object

      • changeCreditCard

        public java.lang.Object changeCreditCard(java.lang.String userType,
                                         long userId,
                                         java.lang.String creditCardType,
                                         java.lang.String creditCardNumber,
                                         java.lang.String expiryDate,
                                         java.lang.String ccv)
        changeCreditCard method, applicable for both Taxi Driver and Customer This method gets as parameters:
        • the usertype (Customer or Taxi Driver)
        • the userid
        • the new creditCardType
        • the new creditCardNumber
        • the new expiryDate and
        • the new ccv
        The appropriate record is fetched from the DB. After the validation, the credit card is changed. The object which was changed, is returned as result. Note: The method returns object in order to avoid several similar methods for TaxiDriver and Customer objects
        Parameters:
        userType - type String
        userId - type long
        creditCardType - type String
        creditCardNumber - type String
        expiryDate - type String
        ccv - type String
        Returns:
        Object

      • changeEmail

        public java.lang.Object changeEmail(java.lang.String userType,
                                    long userId,
                                    java.lang.String email)
        changeEmail method, applicable for both Taxi Driver and Customer This method gets as parameters:
        • the usertype (Customer or Taxi Driver)
        • the userid
        • the new email
        The appropriate record is fetched from the DB. After the validation, the email is changed. The object which was changed, is returned as result. Note: The method returns object in order to avoid several similar methods for TaxiDriver and Customer objects
        Parameters:
        userType - type String
        userId - type long
        email - type String
        Returns:
        Object
